Problem: The output of DictVectorizer was taking up too much memory. So much so, that I couldn’t even fit the linear regression model before running out of memory on my 16 GB machine.
Solution: In the example for DictVectorizer in the scikit-learn website, they set the parameter “sparse” as False. Although this helps with viewing the results, this results in a lot of memory usage. The solution is to either use “sparse=True” instead, or leave it at the default which is also True.
Ahmed Fahim (afahim03@yahoo.com)
